creator: genman@noderunner.net
text:
PropertyFilter adds properties to an existing event.  Same with MapFilter. 
These are "transformers" or something like that.

How does one filter out log events with properties, e.g. MDC values?

You're right, PropertyFilter, ReflectionFilter and MapFilter MODIFY logging
events (message and properties).  It might make sense to rewrite them as
appenders that delegate to another appender instead.

BTW, to filter out log events with MDC values, you could use ExpressionFilter.
creator: sdeboy@iname.com

text:
I also would not be surprised if these "Filters" might not also carry over their modifications into unrelated 
appenders.  For example, if you attached a filter to an appender attached to a specific logger, then the 
modification might be seen by an unrelated appender attached to the root logger.

log4j 1.2 did not provide the methods that allowed mutation on LoggingEvents so these "filters" were not 
backported to the extras companion.  Maybe the functional equivalent delegating appenders could be 
added to "extras".
creator: carnold@apache.org

text:
Actually, log4j1.2 does have this issue - locationInfo.

If you have multiple appenders handling an event, where the 1st appender does
not specify locationinfo=true, but the 2nd does, the 1st appender will see an
event without location info, but subsequent appenders will have location info.
creator: sdeboy@iname.com

text:
Added RewriteAppender and corresponding policies to the receivers companion to replace the MapFilter et 
al functionality in rev 564831.  Requires LoggingEvent.getLogger() which was added to log4j 1.2 in rev 
564830.  Could not be in extras since it depends on LoggingEvent methods that are not in pre 1.2.15 
versions.
